website_summaries.verdict: The best budget model airplane kit to choose when you want an authentic-looking final result.
pros: Large 1:72 scale model is made of durable, easy to assemble pieces
Highly detailed cockpit adds an extra dimension of realism to the final result
cons: Decals often fail to stick completely to the finished surface without peeling

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy plastic and fun to build
customer_reviews.text: Review from the builder :) 10 year old son: My Dad got this for me as my first model. Sturdy plastic and fun to build. Definitely sparked my love for model building.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Nice model
customer_reviews.text: Fun model. Built this because it was the type of plane my father in law worked on while he was in the Navy
customer_reviews.author: Brent E.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking plane
customer_reviews.text: Like the way this turned out and the size. Big enough to see the detail but not so big that it takes up a lot of space

customer_reviews.title: Cool plane .
customer_reviews.text: Great price . Pretty sweet looking after I put it together . Does take a wild to be shipped .

customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting to build ww2 models for a long time. I'm 45 and this was the first model I've built in 30 years and it was great!

product_meta.title: Academy WWII U.S. Navy Fighter F6F-3/5 Model Kit
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Of the 6,477 Japanese aircraft shot down by US Navy pilots in World War II, 5,156 were accounted for by the F6F Hellcat. Prior to its operational debut in 1943, the Navy Wildcats often were no match for the nimble Japanese Zero-Sen. The Hellcat, with its speed, armor and heavy armament changed all that, becoming the dominant fighter of the era.
feature_bullets: Highly detailed cockpit interior and landing gear
Authentic markings available for two versions
Optional part to build as -3 or -5 version included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars96 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
